page.title: 11BARTON HILL FARM
page.content: The{farm}covers an area of 300 acres.Of this there are 45 acres of sugar beet, 60 acres of oilseed rape, 50 acres of winter barley and 140 acres of winter wheat. The remainder is kept as permanent grass for{cattle. The farm has the last remaining herd of White Park cattle in the county with 29 animals. The range of {machinery}includes 6 tractors and trailers, a combine harvester, a baler, a corn drill, a fertiliser spreader and a sugar beet harvester. The{farmer,}Mr. Nettleton, employs 3 full-time men, 2 of whom are his sons. A part-time secretary is employed on Tuesday mornings to help with the paper work. The day normally starts at 7a.m. when the farmer gives the men their instructions. In summer it can finish as late as midnight.
